title: Authors and Citation
text: Robert D (2023). MRMCsamplesize: Sample Sizes Multi-Reader Multi-Case (MRMC) Studies. R package version 1.0.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MRMCsamplesize: Sample Sizes for Multi-Reader Multi-Case (MRMC) Studies},   author = {Dennis Robert},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

what: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
text: sampleSize_MRMC function returns number cases required MRMC study given number readers.

title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
code: sampleSize_MRMC(   endpoint = "auc",   J,   delta,   rangeb,   rangew,   theta,   R = 1,   r1,   r2 = 0.3,   r3 = 0.3,   rb = 0.8,   K = 1,   power = 0.8,   alpha = 0.05,   nu1 = 1,   var_auc = "obuchowski",   reader_var_estimation_method = "normal",   n_reading_sessions_per_reader = 2,   corr = FALSE,   ICC = NULL,   s = NULL )

title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
text: endpoint Character string inform endpoint MRMC study. Values can either auc sensitivity specificity. 0 1. J number readers study. recommended minimum 4 readers MRMC study. delta Effect size denoting anticipated difference endpoint two interventions/imaging-modalities/techniques. Typically choosen values 0.04, 0.05 0.06. 0 1. rangeb Inter-reader variability (sometimes referred -reader variability) range denoting anticipated difference highest accuracy observer study lowest accuracy observer study. numeric value 0 1. rangew Intra-reader variability range (sometimes referred within-reader variability) denoting anticipated difference accuracies observer interprets images using imaging technique two different times. numeric value 0 1. theta Expected average value endpoint J readers. R Ratio non-diseased cases diseased cases. Defaults 1. r1 Correlation accuracies estimated sample patients observer using different imaging techniques. Rockette (1998) recommended value 0.47 use lack pilot data. r2 Correlation accuracies estimated sample patients different observers using imaging technique. assumed r2 = r3 default calculations. r3 Correlation accuracies estimated sample patients different readers using different imaging techniques. assumed r2 = r3 default calculations. rb Correlation accuracies obtained set observers examines sample patients using different diagnostic test. default value 0.8 recommended Rockette, Obuchowski Hillis. K Number times reader interprets images imaging technique. always equal 1 fully-crossed paired-reader paired-case study design. power Power detect delta given assumptions. Default value 0.8 corresponding 80 percent power. alpha type error rate. Default value 0.05 corresponding 5 percent type error (significance level). nu1 Numerator degrees freedom F-distribution used estimate non-centrality parameter (lambda). var_auc Variance estimation method endpoint auc. Defaults string obuchowski. value changed blume, method proposed Blume (2009) used estimate variance. reader_var_estimation_method #value = normal uses assumption accuracies distributed normally thus relationship range standard deviation can used estimate inter intra reader variances rangeb rangew. value use rule thumb estimate inter intra reader variances dividing rangeb rangew 4 followed squaring . normal method typically conservative especially J less 30-35. n_reading_sessions_per_reader Number times reader interprets case. Defaults 2 corresponds typical MRMC study 2 modalities. corr Logical value indicating ICC adjusted (code) (FALSE). Defaults FALSE. ICC numerical value 0 1 indicating expected ICC corr TRUE. s Average number lesions diseased cases.

title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
text: list within list object two named lists varComponents - list containing estimated values variances correlation components. ORSampleSizeResults - list containing sample size results.

title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
text: Obuchowski NA, Hillis SL. Sample size tables computer-aided detection studies. AJR J Roentgenol. 2011 Nov;197(5):W821-8. doi: 10.2214/AJR.11.6764. PMID: 22021528; PMCID: PMC3494304 Obuchowski NA. & Rockette . (1995) Hypothesis testing diagnostic accuracy multiple readers multiple tests anova approach dependent observations, Communications Statistics - Simulation Computation, 24:2, 285-308, DOI: 10.1080/03610919508813243 Obuchowski NA. Sample size tables receiver operating characteristic studies. AJR J Roentgenol. 2000;175(3):603-608. doi:10.2214/ajr.175.3.1750603 Rockette , Campbell WL, Britton CA, Holbert JM, King JL, Gur D. Empiric assessment parameters affect design multireader receiver operating characteristic studies. Acad Radiol. 1999;6(12):723-729. doi:10.1016/s1076-6332(99)80468-1 Blume JD. Bounding Sample Size Projections Area ROC Curve. J Stat Plan Inference. 2009 Mar 1;139(1):711-721. doi: 10.1016/j.jspi.2007.09.015. PMID: 20160839; PMCID: PMC2631183.

title: Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
Estimate sample sizes for MRMC studies — sampleSize_MRMC
code: library("MRMCsamplesize") result1 <- sampleSize_MRMC(endpoint = 'auc',J = 10,delta = 0.10,theta = 0.75, rangeb = 0.1, rangew = 0.05, R = 1, r1 = 0.47,corr = FALSE) #>  #>      OR Variance Components  #>  #>           varTR = 0.0002111701 #>            varE = 0.007370216 #>            varR = 0.00105585 #>            varW = 0.001963495 #>            Cov1 = 0.003464002 #>              r1 = 0.47 #>            Cov2 = 0.002211065 #>              r2 = 0.3 #>            Cov3 = 0.002211065 #>              r3 = 0.3 #>  #> NOTE:  #> varTR: Var(T*R), the estimated variance of the interaction between reader and test #> varE: Var(E), the estimated variance of estimated accuracy of a reader due to both intrareader variability and patient sample variability #> varR: Var(R), the inter-reader variance estimated from rangeb #> varW: Var(W), the intra-reader variance estimated from rangew #> Cov1: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by the same reader using different imaging techniques #> r1: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #> Cov2: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using the same imaging technique #> r2: Correlation corresponding to Cov2 #> Cov3: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using different imaging techniques #> r3: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #>  #>  #>  #>      Obuchowski-Rockette Sample Size Estimation Results  #>  #>             ICC = Not applicable #>        nUnits_i = 25 #>        nCases_c = NA #>       nControls = 25 #>          nTotal = 50 #>               J = 10 #>          nReads = 1000 #>              DE = NA #>               s = NA #>           power = 0.8 #>           alpha = 0.05 #>  #> NOTE:  #> ICC: Is intra-class correlation (ICC) considered while estimating sample size #> nUnits_i: Number of required units with presence of at least one lesion assuming independence between units #> nCases_c: Number of required cases with presence of at least one lesion after adjusting for ICC #> nControls: Number of required controls (images/patients without any lesion) #> nTotal: Total sample size (cases) #> J: Number of readers #> nReads: Total number of reads in the MRMC study #> DE: Design effect due to ICC #> s: Assumed average number of lesions in cases with lesions #> power: Assumed power #> alpha: Significance level (Type I error rate) #>  #>  result2 <- sampleSize_MRMC(endpoint = 'auc',J = 20,delta = 0.05,theta = 0.75, rangeb = 0.2, rangew = 0.05, R = 1, r1 = 0.47,corr = TRUE, ICC = 0.5, s = 1.25) #>  #>      OR Variance Components  #>  #>           varTR = 0.0005734828 #>            varE = 0.002583854 #>            varR = 0.002867414 #>            varW = 0.001963495 #>            Cov1 = 0.001214412 #>              r1 = 0.47 #>            Cov2 = 0.0007751563 #>              r2 = 0.3 #>            Cov3 = 0.0007751563 #>              r3 = 0.3 #>  #> NOTE:  #> varTR: Var(T*R), the estimated variance of the interaction between reader and test #> varE: Var(E), the estimated variance of estimated accuracy of a reader due to both intrareader variability and patient sample variability #> varR: Var(R), the inter-reader variance estimated from rangeb #> varW: Var(W), the intra-reader variance estimated from rangew #> Cov1: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by the same reader using different imaging techniques #> r1: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #> Cov2: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using the same imaging technique #> r2: Correlation corresponding to Cov2 #> Cov3: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using different imaging techniques #> r3: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #>  #>  #>  #>      Obuchowski-Rockette Sample Size Estimation Results  #>  #>             ICC = Intra-class correlation applicable #>        nUnits_i = 218 #>        nCases_c = 197 #>       nControls = 197 #>          nTotal = 394 #>               J = 20 #>          nReads = 15760 #>              DE = 1.125 #>               s = 1.25 #>           power = 0.8 #>           alpha = 0.05 #>  #> NOTE:  #> ICC: Is intra-class correlation (ICC) considered while estimating sample size #> nUnits_i: Number of required units with presence of at least one lesion assuming independence between units #> nCases_c: Number of required cases with presence of at least one lesion after adjusting for ICC #> nControls: Number of required controls (images/patients without any lesion) #> nTotal: Total sample size (cases) #> J: Number of readers #> nReads: Total number of reads in the MRMC study #> DE: Design effect due to ICC #> s: Assumed average number of lesions in cases with lesions #> power: Assumed power #> alpha: Significance level (Type I error rate) #>  #>  result3 <- sampleSize_MRMC(endpoint = 'se',J = 15, delta = 0.05, theta = 0.75, rangeb = 0.2, rangew = 0.025, R = 1, r1 = 0.5, corr = TRUE, ICC = 0.5, s = 1.25) #>  #>      OR Variance Components  #>  #>           varTR = 0.0006637031 #>            varE = 0.002311773 #>            varR = 0.003318516 #>            varW = 0.0004908739 #>            Cov1 = 0.001155886 #>              r1 = 0.5 #>            Cov2 = 0.0006935318 #>              r2 = 0.3 #>            Cov3 = 0.0006935318 #>              r3 = 0.3 #>  #> NOTE:  #> varTR: Var(T*R), the estimated variance of the interaction between reader and test #> varE: Var(E), the estimated variance of estimated accuracy of a reader due to both intrareader variability and patient sample variability #> varR: Var(R), the inter-reader variance estimated from rangeb #> varW: Var(W), the intra-reader variance estimated from rangew #> Cov1: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by the same reader using different imaging techniques #> r1: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #> Cov2: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using the same imaging technique #> r2: Correlation corresponding to Cov2 #> Cov3: Covariance between accuracies estimated from the same sample of patients by different readers using different imaging techniques #> r3: Correlation corresponding to Cov1 #>  #>  #>  #>      Obuchowski-Rockette Sample Size Estimation Results  #>  #>             ICC = Intra-class correlation applicable #>        nUnits_i = 103 #>        nCases_c = 93 #>       nControls = 93 #>          nTotal = 186 #>               J = 15 #>          nReads = 5580 #>              DE = 1.125 #>               s = 1.25 #>           power = 0.8 #>           alpha = 0.05 #>  #> NOTE:  #> ICC: Is intra-class correlation (ICC) considered while estimating sample size #> nUnits_i: Number of required units with presence of at least one lesion assuming independence between units #> nCases_c: Number of required cases with presence of at least one lesion after adjusting for ICC #> nControls: Number of required controls (images/patients without any lesion) #> nTotal: Total sample size (cases) #> J: Number of readers #> nReads: Total number of reads in the MRMC study #> DE: Design effect due to ICC #> s: Assumed average number of lesions in cases with lesions #> power: Assumed power #> alpha: Significance level (Type I error rate) #>  #>
